connector.description: Send and receive messages to/from Vert.x Event Bus.

camel.source.path.address.name: camel.source.path.address
camel.source.path.address.description: Sets the event bus address used to communicate

camel.source.endpoint.pubSub.name: camel.source.endpoint.pubSub
camel.source.endpoint.pubSub.description: Whether to use publish/subscribe instead of point to point when sending to a vertx endpoint.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.vertx.host.name: camel.component.vertx.host
camel.component.vertx.host.description: Hostname for creating an embedded clustered EventBus

camel.component.vertx.port.name: camel.component.vertx.port
camel.component.vertx.port.description: Port for creating an embedded clustered EventBus

camel.component.vertx.timeout.name: camel.component.vertx.timeout
camel.component.vertx.timeout.description: Timeout in seconds to wait for clustered Vertx EventBus to be ready. The default value is 60.

camel.component.vertx.vertx.name: camel.component.vertx.vertx
camel.component.vertx.vertx.description: To use the given vertx EventBus instead of creating a new embedded EventBus

camel.component.vertx.vertxOptions.name: camel.component.vertx.vertxOptions
camel.component.vertx.vertxOptions.description: Options to use for creating vertx

camel.component.vertx.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.vertx.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.vertx.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.vertx.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.vertx.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.vertx.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.vertx.vertxFactory.name: camel.component.vertx.vertxFactory
camel.component.vertx.vertxFactory.description: To use a custom VertxFactory implementation
